comments.body:
If you like to avoid this for every task in the integration test, look at this: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/test/integration/targets/win_scheduled_task/tasks/main.yml

We did a few things here:
- A generic test to check capabilities (like you do + version check)
- Only run a specific block based on this test
- Run all tests twice, once in normal mode, then again in check-mode
  - The tests have different *asserts* when the output is expected to be different in check-mode compared to normal mode
I will! I wrote a conditional block for it first, but I must have fat-fingered it. Will check out!

Thanks for the example, that looks like a very nice pattern to follow. I think I'm gonna let the test(s) alone for now in this PR, and then get them updated when there's some movement on the ci agent (we need either windows 2012r2 /wmf5.1 or windows 2016 - ideally both)
